job_tasks.phrase: Develop modules on the basics of AI, Generative AI, and Large Language Models (LLM) architectures.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly relates to creating content about the fundamental concepts and structures of AI and LLMs, which falls under developing and explaining model architectures.

job_tasks.phrase: Provide overviews of traditional AI approaches (ML, NLP, DL, RL) and contrast them with Generative AI techniques.
job_tasks.justification: This involves explaining and contrasting different AI and ML techniques, which is part of understanding and teaching model development.

job_tasks.phrase: Create criteria for AI vs. GenAI use in business applications, including when to use ML vs. LLM models.
job_tasks.justification: This task involves defining the application and selection criteria for different types of models (ML vs. LLM), which is a core aspect of model development and strategy.

job_tasks.phrase: Deliver content on Transformer, GAN, and other LLM architectures, including multimodal LLMs.
job_tasks.justification: This directly refers to explaining the architectures of LLMs and generative models, fitting the definition of Model Development.

job_tasks.phrase: Develop course material on different LLM architectures, such as Llama3 and Gemma 2, and tools like OpenAI & Anthropic Claude.
job_tasks.justification: This involves creating educational content specifically on LLM architectures and models, aligning with Model Development.

job_tasks.phrase: Provide instruction on model evaluation, token counting, deployment options, and considerations of model size, speed, and cost.
job_tasks.justification: This covers aspects of model performance, deployment, and operational characteristics, which are integral to the model development lifecycle.

job_tasks.phrase: Design courses on identifying and quantifying AI project value and translating business objectives into technical plans.
job_tasks.justification: This task focuses on the planning and scoping of AI projects, which is a precursor to and part of the model development process.

job_tasks.phrase: Teach methods for selecting appropriate technologies and models for specific business needs.
job_tasks.justification: This involves guiding the selection of models and technologies based on business requirements, a key aspect of model development strategy.

job_tasks.phrase: Develop lessons on vector and graph databases for AI applications, with a focus on comparing VectorDB and GraphDB options.
job_tasks.justification: This task involves creating content about databases used for AI applications, specifically vector and graph databases, which are crucial for data management in AI.

job_tasks.phrase: Explore various database platforms, such as Singlestore, MongoDB, and Milvus, for AI app integration.
job_tasks.justification: This involves discussing database platforms relevant to AI applications, fitting under Data Engineering and Management.

job_tasks.phrase: Teach concepts of LLM alignment, including RLHF and feedback models, along with instruction tuning for LLMs.
job_tasks.justification: This directly relates to advanced techniques for tuning and aligning LLMs, which falls under Model Development.

job_tasks.phrase: Design modules on fine-tuning using libraries like Hugging Face, with techniques such as PEFT, QLORA, and AdaLORA.
job_tasks.justification: This task is explicitly about fine-tuning LLMs using specific libraries and techniques, a core part of Model Development.

job_tasks.phrase: Provide instruction on architecting production-grade RAG pipelines on cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
job_tasks.justification: This task is specifically about architecting RAG pipelines, which is a direct application of prompt engineering and retrieval augmented generation.

job_tasks.phrase: Explain when to use RAG vs. fine-tuning in AI applications.
job_tasks.justification: This involves comparing and contrasting RAG with fine-tuning, a key aspect of understanding prompt engineering and model adaptation strategies.

job_tasks.phrase: Teach metrics and best practices for LLM evaluation, including BLEU, ROUGE, and MMLU.
job_tasks.justification: This involves teaching evaluation metrics for LLMs, which is a crucial part of the model development and assessment process.

job_tasks.phrase: Design modules on deploying and scaling LLMs on cloud platforms and optimizing inference with ML hardware accelerators.
job_tasks.justification: This task focuses on the deployment, scaling, and optimization of LLMs in production environments, which falls under MLOps/LLMOps.

job_tasks.phrase: Develop content on implementing ML guardrails and compliance measures for LLM use, and collecting user feedback for continuous improvement.
job_tasks.justification: This involves creating content on implementing safeguards and collecting feedback for LLM use, which relates to responsible model development and improvement.

job_tasks.phrase: Provide instruction on MLOps, DevOps, and AIOps, including CI/CD, monitoring, and detecting model drift.
job_tasks.justification: This task directly covers MLOps, DevOps, and AIOps, including CI/CD and monitoring, which are core to the operational management of AI systems.

job_tasks.phrase: Teach the basics of AI agents, Langgraph, and Autogen for multi-agent collaboration and task management.
job_tasks.justification: This involves teaching about AI agents and frameworks for their collaboration, which is a form of model/system development and application.

job_tasks.phrase: Create criteria for AI vs. GenAI use in business applications, including when to use ML vs. LLM models.
job_tasks.justification: This involves understanding business applications and selecting appropriate AI/GenAI models for them, linking technical choices to business needs.

job_tasks.phrase: Design courses on identifying and quantifying AI project value and translating business objectives into technical plans.
job_tasks.justification: This task focuses on understanding business value and objectives and translating them into technical plans, a key aspect of business understanding and strategy.

job_tasks.phrase: Teach methods for selecting appropriate technologies and models for specific business needs.
job_tasks.justification: This involves aligning technology and model selection with specific business needs, demonstrating business understanding.

job_tasks.phrase: Develop content on AI regulations and ethics, covering governance and responsible AI practices (e.g., EU AI Act).
job_tasks.justification: This task involves understanding and teaching about AI ethics, regulations, and governance, which are crucial business and strategic considerations for AI implementation.

soft_skills.justification: Creating educational resources implies a need to communicate complex information effectively to learners, aligning with communication skills.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses entirely on developing course content about AI and GenAI topics, including LLM architectures, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, MLOps, and AI ethics. There are no tasks related to building or integrating these concepts into software applications (Macro-Category A). All identified tasks fall under Macro-Category B (GenAI Specialization) or Overarching Professional Skills (like Business Understanding & Strategy, which are supportive of the specialization). Therefore, the role is best classified as a GenAI Specialist.

confidence.reasoning: The job advertisement is very clear and detailed, explicitly outlining the specific AI and GenAI topics to be covered in the course content. The scope of the role is well-defined, leaving little room for ambiguity regarding the required expertise.
